oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Cash on Cash with John Carter Cash - 2017-05-12
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by John Carter Cash honoring his father Johnny Cash from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on May 12, 2017.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: John Carter Cash; Ana Christina Cash; George Daeger; Dave Daeger;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (00:12) Opening comments and introduction by Maureen Aguilar / (01:27) Opening theme and comments from John Carter Cash about the history of music in Tennessee and the Carter Family / (05:44) Performs Keep On The Sunny Side / (07:39) Talks about his father Johnny Cash listening to music in his early life, joining the U.S. Air Force and beginning to write songs / (10:21) Performs Folsom Prison Blues / (12:39) Talks about Johnny's post military career / (13:55) Performs Big River / (16:33) Talks about his Dad meeting Luther Perkins and Marshall Grant and the importance of gospel music in their lives / (18:34) Performs I Was There When It Happened / (21:12) Introduces his band members George and Dave Daeger / (21:44) More history about the early recording and touring days of Johnny Cash / (24:12) Performs I Walk The Line / (26:43) Talks about the touring road life and the hazards of drug addiction / (27:52) Talks about Patsy Cline touring with Johnny Cash /

(28:23) Talks about Johnny asking June Carter to join his road show / (31:21) Introduces his wife Ana Cristina Cash / (31:48) Performs Ring Of Fire (with Ana Christina Cash) / (34:47) Talks about the 1960's and his father's divorce and marriage to June / (36:24) Performs Jackson (with Ana Christina Cash) / (39:34) John Carter talks about the year surrounding his birth and traveling around the world with his parents / (41:09) Johnny making music through the 1970's and 1980's recording with The Highwaymen / (41:46) Talks about his Dad beginning to work with Rick Rubin in the 1990's / (44:15) Talks about working with his father on the American 3 Solitary Man project and his father's failing health / (47:53) Performs Hurt / (51:21) Talks about the unbroken circle and their meaning and purpose / (52:40) Performs Will The Circle Be Unbroken / (54:26) Closing comments and theme / (55:37) Program end / (55:58) FILE END.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cash, John Carter; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
